newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - March 17.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - March 17.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Interim report of Special Presidential Commission inquiring into malpractices finds two former United National Party ministers and two former senior officials guilty of misuse of power. The commission recommended that one minister and the two officials be stripped of their civic rights. The other minister died last year.
Pucara ground attack aircraft of Sri Lanka Air Force crashes in Medirigiriya in northeastern Sri Lanka.

There are no more genetlmen in politics, says President Chandrika Kumaratunga referring to the UNP which was once known for 'gentlemen' such as former prime ministers D.S. Senanayake and his son Dudley Senanayake and Sri John Kotelawala.
Pucara ground attack craft of Sri Lanka Air Force crashes in Medirigiriya.
Special Presidential Commission inquiring into malpractices in public places recommends a former UNP minister and two former senior officials be stripped of civic rights.
Establishment of National Health Commission recommended to develop state health sector.
